newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: One dead, 40 injured in Czech train crash - agency.
newsitem.headline: One dead, 40 injured in Czech train crash - agency.

text.p: One person was killed and at least 40 others were injured when two Czech trains collided on Monday on the Turnov-Hradec Kralove line, northeast of Prague, the news agency CTK reported.
CTK said the accident occurred at about 7 a.m. (0600 GMT) when a passenger train collided with a cargo train near the village of Sedmihorky, about 100 km (60 miles) north-east of Prague.
CTK said Czech Railways spokeswoman Hana Dluhosova confirmed the crash and casualties, but could give no further details.
She added that there was no initial indication as to why the accident had occured.
The injured were taken to hospitals in the nearby town of Turnov, about five Km from Sedmihorky.
